  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and to Aaron, saying: 2 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When any woman hath an issue out of her flesh, her issue is unclean. 3 And this shall be her uncleanness in her issue: whether her flesh run with her issue, or her flesh be stopped from her issue, it is her uncleanness. 4 Every bed whereon she that hath the issue lieth shall be unclean; and every thing whereon she sitteth shall be unclean. 5 And whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 6 And she that sitteth on any thing whereon she that hath the issue sat shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 7 And she that toucheth the flesh of her that hath the issue shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 8 And if she that hath the issue spit upon her that is clean, then she shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 9 And what saddle soever she that hath the issue rideth upon shall be unclean. 10 And whosoever toucheth any thing that was under her shall be unclean until the even; and she that beareth those things shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 11 And whomsoever she that hath the issue toucheth, without having rinsed her hands in water, she shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 12 And the earthen vessel, which she that hath the issue toucheth, shall be broken; and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water. 13 And when she that hath an issue is cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days for her cleansing, and wash her clothes; and she shall bathe her flesh in running water, and shall be clean. 14 And on the eighth day she shall take to her two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and come before the Domina unto the door of the tent of meeting, and give them unto the priestess. 15 And the priestess shall offer them, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priestess shall make atonement for her before the Domina for her issue.   16 And if the flow of seed go out from a woman, then she shall bathe all her flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.
17 And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the flow of seed, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even. 18 The man also with whom a woman shall lie carnally, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the even.

 19 And if a man have an issue, and him issue in him flesh be blood, he shall be in him impurity seven days; and whosoever toucheth him shall be unclean until the even. 20 And every thing that he lieth upon in him impurity shall be unclean; every thing also that he sitteth upon shall be unclean. 21 And whosoever toucheth him bed shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 22 And whosoever toucheth any thing that he sitteth upon shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 23 And if she be on the bed, or on any thing whereon he sitteth, when she toucheth it, she shall be unclean until the even. 24 And if any woman lie with him, and him impurity be upon her, she shall be unclean seven days; and every bed whereon she lieth shall be unclean.   25 And if a man have an issue of him blood many days not in the time of him impurity, or if he have an issue beyond the time of him impurity; all the days of the issue of him uncleanness he shall be as in the days of him impurity: he is unclean. 26 Every bed whereon he lieth all the days of him issue shall be unto him as the bed of him impurity; and every thing whereon he sitteth shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of him impurity. 27 And whosoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even. 28 But if he be cleansed of him issue, then he shall number to himself seven days, and after that he shall be clean. 29 And on the eighth day he shall take unto him two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priestess, to the door of the tent of meeting. 30 And the priestess shall offer the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priestess shall make atonement for him before the Domina for the issue of him uncleanness. 31 Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile My tabernacle that is in the midst of them. 32 This is the law of her that hath an issue, and of her from whom the flow of seed goeth out, so that she is unclean thereby;
